description: The BBQ Pit once had a corten steel hood, but it was removed because the differing materials didn't age well together. This communal space has evolved over time, adapting to material challenges and changing needs.
extended_description: Originally featuring a corten steel hood, its current form demonstrates the importance of material compatibility in long-lasting structures. The pit and nearby seating areas continue to serve as gathering spaces, highlighting the social aspects of architectural design. The BBQ Pit remains a beloved spot for community events. It emphasizes the role of architecture in fostering social interaction.
